comments.commentBody: Deflect, accuse....defame.

Absolutely.  Do not give him the press he got during the nipomination and election process for nothing.  Put your resources where they can really count--seeing if you can find evidence of illegal behavior or worse treason and sedition.  Heck even if it is "only" tax evasion or RICO, we'll take that too.  I do wonder, though, if there was some secretive investigation of his contacts with Russia going on during the campaign unknown to Obama.  Strange bedfellows in this WH.

Trump's wires are crossed and short circuiting. He's close to a mental breakdown.  Is this the person we want to have access to the nuclear code? What makes it even worse is that Trump actually thinks that these baseless charges will make people believe that he's telling the truth.  Exit, stage right, Donald.

Hello, I am attaching an article which includes a great amount of serious research on all the data manipulation which exists and if not regulated will continue influencing through highly developed technology the opinions of people in general. This makes classics like Orwell's "1984 " and Bradbury's '"Fahrenheit 451" sound like kinder stories!
All this talk about Fake Media is being instrumented and NYT has been attacked, as a subscriber I hope you will write editorials on this top priority subject. Regards Miguel Lindemann

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/feb/26/robert-mercer-breitbart...
Is he directly quoting Putin? Is that why wire tapping is in quotes?

There is no clearer evidence of Trump Derangement Syndrome than some of the comments on this article.

Whether anyone likes it or not, Trump is now President. This means he has access to any piece of information he wants.

It is bordering on impossible for me to believe he would have stated what he did about President Obama without having strong evidence. Even the NYT has published reporting that states there has never been any evidence uncovered of collusion by Trump aides with the Russians. Speaker Ryan reiterated that last night.

There exists a significant amount of "de-emphasized" reporting which suggests Obama may very well have engaged in the type of behavior President Trump is alleging. Just a few days before leaving office, he relaxed rules about sharing intelligence. Previous NYT reporting document that information on Flynn was obtained via wiretaps. Leaks about President Trumps phone calls with other world leaders undoubtedly came from wiretaps.

President Trump should come forward and hold a press conference and release all the information he has and settle this once and for all.

Perhaps as the readers suggest he has no evidence and he is just carelessly accusing a former President of potential criminal behavior.

But people have serially underestimated the President since he announced. I think it is dangerous to just dismiss what he is saying now, especially because of the vast powers he now has and the information he now has access to.
Incorrect. The truth is, Trump has a pattern of stating things that are demonstrably untrue. You left that part out.
Or maybe he came out with this stuff because he's just wildly irresponsible. Ample evidence to support that theory.

Dr. Alvarado, you are straining very hard to discredit calls for an independent investigation on the grounds that the details of unexplained favoritism to Russia's aggressive behavior in Europe and its clear interference with an American election -- coupled with lies about private contact with Russian officials during the campaign -- cannot be known without an independent investigation. The most charitable thing which can be said about your comment is that it is remarkable circular.

Our figurehead* has uncontrolled, and apparently uncontrollable, mental and verbal diarrhea. And the output has about as much value as the physical type.

*he's not fit to lick the shoes of any actual president.
When Trump is impeached ,  his defence will probably be that he is unfit mentally to stand trial or is responsible for his actions.
People can be banned from Twitter, yes. Now that would be something to see.

Loretta Lynch expanded surveillance programs in the last month she was AG. If they were "truly concerned" about Donald Trump, would the Obama administration have done that?

I think we're being played by both parties.
Giving greater credence to Breitbart over the intelligence community?  The many adversaries of the US must be noting how easily this man can be manipulated.

Donald Trump's untruthful denigration of former President Obama lowers the bar even further - just when we thought it couldn't get any lower.  Will there be no end to this mind torture of the American public by this president?  We're sick and tired of his incivil behavior and tumult after a mere six weeks.  It seems like six years.  Tuesday night's speech was just a superficial makeover to make him look more presidential by his cohorts.  Now it's back to "normal."   School children used to be encouraged to want to become President of the United States.  It was considered an honor.  With the current President Trump, children do not have any role model to look up to or emulate.  What they have is a paranoid, lying demagogue who is constantly stirring up the pot with unbalanced behavior.  Our children deserve better than this.  What will the effect of his presidency be on them?  If you you think we lack in leadership now, our children's future looks even more bleak should we foolishly continue to elect individuals such as Donald Trump.  Who will run for President in 2020?  2024?  Where are the leaders?  Time to put civics back in the classroom.
I must admit I never thought I would see a president more paranoid than Nixon.

Why is Trump making this claim? He always throws out absurd accusations when he wants to distract attention -- throwing fireworks around to distract the crowd from the pickpocketers in their midst.

In this case, I think he is worried that too much attention is being paid to his Russia connections. All the more reason for an independent Special Prosecutor to look into his ties to Russia.
All this 1984 double speak is getting old.

Well, I would certainly hope the man's phones were wiretapped. I've read about numerous reasons for probable cause for the last year and a half.

I say thank you to those who did if they did. Trump is an infinitely extreme security risk.

This is the actions of a desperate, unstable man. He feels he is always right and people are out to make up things to get him. How can he be relieved of his job and gotten help before he causes real harm to the country.

Well, maybe the wiretap part is true. We do not know at this time the details of what the FBI and intelligence community have been able to determine about the Russian hacking but that effort, under a FISA approval, could well have led to such a tap. Although the notion that President Obama ordered the thing, if indeed there was such a tap, is preposterous, Trump is well aware that his credulous followers will accept the claim as gospel. I suppose that gives the man some comfort. But really, how long can this go on.
Meanwhile he'll continue to go after the press for printing false stories based on unnamed sources.
Ed Koch, the late mayor of NYC, supposedly once said, "I wouldn't believe anything Donald Trump said if his tongue was notarized."
I'm convinced we'll get to the bottom of this--just as soon as we learn what those "unbelievable" things Trump's investigators found in Hawaii were.
Except that Trump lacks the pathos of a Captain Queeg who served his country steadfastly in a Navy and military that had been neglected and all but forgotten by the time they were really needed.
I am in no way an expert, but when I read his tweets, it sounds like the ranting of a lunatic.
How does one prove a negative?
Maybe Melanie should live with him!
